body: Here at the high noon of holiday shopping in Manhattan, the future of the e-commerce revolution is increasingly dependent on a low-tech, often-despised grunt: the bicycle messenger. Newly belted with two-way radios and data pagers, tracked by sophisticated routing software, these two-wheeled e-liverers are more in demand, more highly paid, better
title: Selling Online, Delivering on Bikes; Low-Tech Courier Services Thrive On Growth of Web-Based Retailing

body: For 13 years, Erez Hayun and his father, Moshe, have been working out of their woodshop at 225 Taaffe Place, near the Pratt Institute, making kitchen cabinets and furniture for Hasidic families in Williamsburg. title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: NORTH BROOKLYN; High-End Woodworking Can't Keep Up With Rents

body: They usually make their living parachuting into wildernesses from Alaska to New Mexico, where they fight forest fires, or rather, corral them by chopping breaks through the trees. title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: NEW YORK UP CLOSE; In Wild, Wild East, Smoke Jumpers Stalk Beetles

title: Pest Is Eating at City's Edges; A Cleaner Harbor Gives New Life to Marine Borers

title: Son Is Accused of Killing His Father And 2d Man in Their Hospital Room

body: Chris Ruckert usually works in Long Island's pine barrens enforcing hunting and fishing regulations as an officer for the State Department of Environmental Conservation. title: State Cracks Down on New York City Trash Transfer Stations

body: A dentist from New Jersey is found dead in his maroon Oldsmobile on an East Village street. A young drifter dies on the same street in a tenement that he shared with squatters. title: 4 Deaths, 4 Places, One Problem: An Increase in the Use of Heroin

title: CURRENTS: VISUAL AID; The Universe Is a Flip Away

body: Two months after local officials spotted the Asian long-horned beetle in Bayside, Queens, the State Department of Agriculture and Markets has created a 7.5-square mile beetle quarantine zone in the northeast corner of Queens. Under the quarantine, any firewood or yard waste that includes wood would have to be inspected by state or Federal officials
title: METRO NEWS BRIEFS: NEW YORK; Quarantine Zone Created To Contain Asian Beetle

title: PUBLIC LIVES; Behind a Badge, Confronting Issues of Race

title: MY BROOKLYN; Still a Contender on the Waterfront

body: IT is one of New York City's weirder environmental ironies: as the mucky rivers get cleaner and clearer, kayakers and striped bass are not the only things coming back to the water. A couple of tiny, voracious creatures -- a mollusk and a crustacean -- have also begun to reappear, and it seems their sole occupation is to eat all the wooden pilings
title: PUBLIC LIVES; A Man With a Fish's-Eye View of the City

body: A coalition of community and environmental groups and the Borough of Brooklyn filed suit yesterday to overturn the city's rules for the placement of garbage transfer stations, calling the regulations ''deficient, arbitrary, capricious and an abuse of discretion.'' They asked that new rules be written under much stricter environmental guidelines.
title: Lawsuit Over Plan for Trash Transfer Stations

body: JACQUES ROCH sometimes has the sense that he is back in the Paris of the late 50's, once again living in a neighborhood with slant-roofed garrets and bustling street life. title: Prices Send Loft Pioneers In Search of New Frontiers

body: THE dark brick factory complex on the Brooklyn waterfront would not look out of place in a moody industrial landscape by Edward Hopper. title: Off the Urban Rust Heap, a Factory Goes to Work
